snippet.title: Gold prices edge up for the first time in a week
snippet.description: Gold prices settled higher for the first time in a week as tensions between Russia and Ukraine give the precious metal some support.

snippet.title: Stocks close mostly higher on earnings; Apple up
snippet.description: The stock market closed mostly higher Thursday, helped by positive earnings out of several large U.S. companies including Apple and construction equipment maker Caterpillar.

snippet.title: Last year's deadbeats do best as stocks stall
snippet.description: Financial markets rarely stick to the script, and this year is no different.

snippet.title: College is not a losing investment
snippet.description: Job and wage prospects are healthy for those with university degrees.

snippet.title: Palladium prices rising as mining strike continues
snippet.description: Platinum and palladium prices are rising as a dispute between Russia and Ukraine along with a strike in South Africa push prices up.

snippet.title: Dirty Dollars: That paper money is teeming with germs
snippet.description: Also: the price of home ownership and the benefits of financial literacy

snippet.title: D.C. community calendar, April 24-May. 1, 2014
snippet.description: Ears ringing?, Emancipation and Home Rule, Shakespeare birthday, Gilbert and Sullivan auditions.

snippet.title: Crusades fought, eBay bids sought for relics
snippet.description: Wars have been fought to obtain them. Medieval monks and modern-day bandits have pilfered them. Two millennia after the first Christian martyrs' blood stained Rome, the temptation of, and fascination with, religious relics endures. And the canonization of two well-loved popes, John Paul II and John XXIII, on Sunday is feeding a seemingly endless appetite for fresh relics.

snippet.title: Trouble in Ukraine lifts prices for corn, wheat
snippet.description: Unrest in the Ukraine pushed up prices for corn and wheat Tuesday.

snippet.title: House Calls: Transition to a new dining room
snippet.description: One Bethesda resident loves her dining room's traditional aspects, but wants a more transitional design.
